column2: Prior to last year, where I attended my first meeting, it was going down  the amount of money being spent by countries was going down and down very substantially.
column4: Since 2014, "each year, (NATO) nations have been increasing their contributions."

column2: And now, it's going up very substantially.
column4: Since 2014, "each year, (NATO) nations have been increasing their contributions."

column2: But the United States was paying for anywhere from 70 to 90 percent of it, depending on the way you calculate.
column4: The United States was paying for anywhere from 70 to 90 percent of (NATO), depending on the way you calculate.

column2: And one state said  you know, it was interesting, one of the states we won, Wisconsin  I didn't even realize this until fairly recently  that was the one state Ronald Reagan didn't win when he ran the board his second time.
column4: Says Wisconsin "hadnt been won by a Republican since Dwight D. Eisenhower, in 1952. And I won Wisconsin.  Ronald Reagan, remember, Wisconsin was the state that Ronald Reagan did not win."

column2: I was not in favor of that war.
column4: I was totally against the war in Iraq.

column2: I was very much against that war.
column4: I was totally against the war in Iraq.
